Detailed Description

template<class T = double> template class HighpassFilter

The HighpassFilter class provides a high-pass second order butterworth filter.

Example Program: 

//======================================================================== 
// Project: Robotic Platform.
// ---------------------------------------------------------------------- 
// Package      : The Math Library
// Authors      : 
// Start Date   : Wed Dec 20 11:08:28 GMT 2000
// Compiler     : GNU c++
// Operating System : QNX RTP
// ----------------------------------------------------------------------  
// File: HighpassFilter.t.cpp
// Example program for the high-pass filter class.
//========================================================================  

#include "HighpassFilter.hpp"


#include <iostream.h>
#include <math.h>
#include <stdio.h>
#include <stdlib.h>

#define PI 3.14


double wn = 600;  // cut-off freq. in Hz
double dirtySignal[7000];
double filteredSignal[7000];

double p ;

HighpassFilter<double> myFilter(wn, .000143);
// Define filter, with a sampling period as the second argument.


int main()
{
  FILE *outfile1, *outfile2;
  myFilter.initializeFilter(0.0, 0.0);
  outfile1 = fopen("dirty.dat", "w+");
  outfile2 = fopen("clean.dat", "w+");

  cout << "The cutoff Frequency in hertz: " << myFilter.getCutOffFrequencyHz() << endl;
  cout << "The cutoff Frequency in rad/sec: " << myFilter.getCutOffFrequencyRad() << endl;
  

 for (int i=0; i<7000; i++)
 {
   p = ((double)i)/7000.0; 
   dirtySignal[i] = 2 +  sin(2*PI*p/10) + sin(60*2*PI*p) + sin(700*2*PI*p);
   filteredSignal[i] = myFilter.filter(dirtySignal[i]);

   //simply write the outputs to a file and check it using matlab... 
     fprintf(outfile1, "%f \n", dirtySignal[i]);
     fprintf(outfile2, "%f \n", filteredSignal[i]);
 }


 fclose(outfile1);
 fclose(outfile2);

return(0);
}

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

HighpassFilter ( ) [inline]
 

The default Constructor. Sets cut-off frequency to 1 Hertz and sampling period to 0.001 sec.

HighpassFilter ( double cutOffFrequencyHz,
double samplingPeriod ) [inline]
 

This constructor for the filter initializes the parameters of the filter.

Parameters:
cutOffFrequencyHz   The cut-off frequency of the high pass butterworth filter in hertz.
samplingPeriod   The sampling period of the filter in seconds.
